title: Why do Finns have blonde hair and blue eyes if they have Asian DNA? - Quora

response.answer_text: Finland is the only landbridge from Scandanavia to northern Europe. Especiall Sweden did a lot of trading via that road. So many Finns are darker due to the influence of lapplanders/reindeer herders. But there is a lot of blonde fair skin there too. LOTS of mixing. The name of a shamaness is ‘finnwife’. As the eastern shamanism is picked up there. So anyway I have 10% Asian DNA as well but more Irish. I am mixed. And rather pleased with the 10% Asian.

The majority of their DNA is European, even though slightly more than half of their Y-DNA originated in East Asia: Haplogroup N-M231 - Wikipedia  Map of European DNA. This map shows that Lithuanians, Latvians and Estonians also carry Haplogroup N ( purple) as their main Y-DNA.  Finns resembling East Asians even though they have blonde hair:
